pr_title: GEODE-8138: Improve semantics of the redis-port option

timeline.bodyText: Is the default now 6379? Also I think you want a "." at the end of the sentence.
timeline.author: dschneider-pivotal

replies.bodyText: Yes. Thank you for finding this!
replies.author: sabbey37

timeline.bodyText: For gfsh start server I thought the default would be 6379
timeline.author: dschneider-pivotal

timeline.bodyText: I see this checking the password and bindAddress setting. But shouldn't it also be checking the redisPort? The comment says port and bind-address. Perhaps any redis option (including password) should enable redis.
timeline.author: dschneider-pivotal

replies.bodyText: You are right. What do you think? Maybe it would make sense to enable it if any redis option is specified?
replies.author: sabbey37

timeline.bodyText: Should this use RANDOM_PORT_INDICATOR instead of 0?
timeline.author: dschneider-pivotal

timeline.bodyText: Is it correct that if it is < RANDOM_PORT_INDICATOR it will use the default? I couldn't find the code that made that happen but it seems odd if I say -33456 it will listen on 6379. I think I'd prefer an IllegalArgumentException
timeline.author: dschneider-pivotal

replies.bodyText: That is currently what happens. I like what you're suggesting though.
replies.author: sabbey37

timeline.bodyText: Why add in the word "service" here? Why not just "redis-enabled". None of the other redis properties use the word "service". I think consistent naming conventions are really important to avoid confusion.
timeline.author: pivotal-jbarrett
